extendedIngredients.name: fresh thyme leaves
extendedIngredients.originalString: 4 teaspoons fresh thyme leaves or 2 teaspoons dried

extendedIngredients.name: leeks
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 large leeks, trimmed and thoroughly washed

extendedIngredients.name: parsley
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 cup coarsely chopped parsley (about 1 large bunch)

extendedIngredients.name: potatoes
extendedIngredients.originalString: 4 small potatoes, scrubbed but not peeled

extendedIngredients.name: salt
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 teaspoons salt, or more to taste

recipes.title: Super-Simple Vegetable Broth
recipes.instructions: Chop carrots, onions, celery and leeks into 1- to 2-inch chunks; leave the potatoes whole. Combine the vegetables with the remaining ingredients in a soup pot or stock pot. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to maintain a simmer and simmer for 1 hour. Strain the broth through a colander, then once more through a fine sieve. If the broth tastes weak, pour it back into the pot and simmer until reduced to a flavor you prefer, 20 to 30 minutes more.Nutrition;.Nutrition Note: After straining and skimming, broth has negligible steps.step: Chop carrots, onions, celery and leeks into 1- to 2-inch chunks; leave the potatoes whole.

Combine the vegetables with the remaining ingredients in a soup pot or stock pot. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to maintain a simmer and simmer for 1 hour. Strain the broth through a colander, then once more through a fine sieve. If the broth tastes weak, pour it back into the pot and simmer until reduced to a flavor you prefer, 20 to 30 minutes more.Nutrition;.Nutrition Note: After straining and skimming, broth has negligible calories and nutrients except sodium (397 mg per cup).More From Eating
